1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience

2.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

3.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
to deride; by implication (as if imitating a foreigner) to speak unintelligibly

4.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
a contemplation; by implication, an utterance
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

5.brief: to turn; by implication, to face, i.e. appear, look, etc.
near, with or among; often in general, to
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

6.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman

7.brief: morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
to remove (intransitive or transitive) figuratively, to grow old; specifically, to transcribe
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to be strong; by implication, to prevail, act insolently
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

8.brief: seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

9.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
a (sudden) alarm (properly, the object feared, by implication, the feeling)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

10.brief: to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to detest; by implication, to reject
to slip out, i.e. escape; causatively, to deliver
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to miscarry, i.e. suffer abortion; by analogy, to bereave (literally or figuratively)

11.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
something born, i.e. a lad or offspring
properly, to stamp, i.e. to spring about (wildly or for joy)

12.brief: to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

13.brief: to fail; by implication to wear out, decay (causatively, consume, spend)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a wink (of the eyes), i.e. a very short space of time
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
to sink, i.e. descend; causatively, to press or lead down

14.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire

15.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to work (in any sense); by implication, to serve, till, (causatively) enslave, etc.

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, to ascend; figuratively, to be valuable (objectively; useful, subjectively; benefited)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to impinge, by accident or violence, or (figuratively) by importunity

16.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to widen (in any direction), i.e. (intransitively) recede or (transitively) remove (literally or figuratively, of place or relation)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

a lamp (i.e. the burner) or light (literally or figuratively)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to be extinguished; figuratively, to expire or be dried up
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

18.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, material, i.e. (specifically) refuse haum or stalks of grain (as chopped in threshing and used for fodder)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
chaff (as pressed out, i.e. winnowed or (rather) threshed loose)
to thieve (literally or figuratively); by implication, to deceive

19.brief: to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
to be safe (in mind, body or estate); figuratively, to be (causatively, make) completed; by implication, to be friendly; by extension, to reciprocate (in various applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

20.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses

a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
the new moon; by implication, a month
properly, to chop into, pierce or sever; hence, to curtail, to distribute (into ranks);  to shoot an arrow

22.brief: strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
properly, to goad, i.e. (by implication) to teach (the rod being an Oriental incentive)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)

23.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tranquil; (in a bad sense) careless; abstractly, security

24.brief: a receptacle (for milk, i.e. pail; figuratively, breast)
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame
to quaff, i.e. (causatively) to irrigate or furnish apotion to

25.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud

a maggot (as rapidly bred), literally or figuratively

a plan, usually evil (machination), sometimes good (sagacity)

to be violent; by implication, to maltreat

morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand

30.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a stack of sheaves; by analogy, a tomb
to be alert, i.e. sleepless; hence to be on the lookout (whether for good or ill)

33.brief: to suck, by implication, to relish, or (intransitively) be sweet
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to draw, used in a great variety of applications (including to sow, to sound, to prolong, to develop, to march, to remove, to delay, to be tall, etc.)

a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
a recurrence (of time or place); a reply (as returned)
